translations.translation: He added that he has a mouse that was cured of diabetes four months ago.

Dr. Ehud Ur, a professor at Dalhousie University's medical school in Halifax, Nova Scotia and president of the Canadian Diabetes Association's clinical science department, has warned that this research is still in its early stages.
Like other experts, he is skeptical about the treatment of diabetes and notes that these results are irrelevant to type 1 diabetes patients.

On Monday, Sara Danius, the Permanent Secretary of the Swedish Academy's Literature Committee and Nobel Prize laureate in literature, announced publicly that they had given up on trying to contact Bob Dylan directly with the news of his 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature.
"Mr Danius has said that 'we are doing nothing at the moment. He rang his closest collaborator and received a very kind response, which for now seems to be sufficient.'"
It was Jamie Siminoff, the CEO of Ring, who started the company after being unable to hear the doorbell from his shop in the garage.
He said he made a wireless doorbell (Wi-Fi doorbell).
Since appearing on an episode of the show where a contestant had their funding request rejected by the investors, Siminoff has seen sales increase.
In late 2017, Shiminov appeared on the shopping television channel QVC.
Ring has also reached an agreement with ADT, a competing security company, regarding their lawsuit.
One experimental vaccine appears to be able to reduce Ebola mortality rates, but no medication has been clearly proven to treat existing infections up until now.
ZMapp, an experimental antibody cocktail, showed promise in its early stages but official studies suggest it has a smaller-than-expected effect on preventing death.
In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control group. That is, scientists used ZMapp as a standard and compared it to three other treatments.

The United States Gymnastics Federation supports the letter from the US Olympic Committee and acknowledges the absolute necessity of Olympic officials ensuring that former athletes in the US have a safe environment.
We agree with the USOC's assertion that by pursuing meaningful change within our organization, we can achieve better outcomes for athletes, teams, and sports.

The US Gymnastics Federation supports an independent investigation to determine how the facts that Larry Nassar's victims have courageously revealed were not uncovered sooner and to take necessary measures so that such a tragedy never happens again.

The USA Gymnastics team and the USOC share a common goal, which is to make gymnastics and other sports as safe as possible so that athletes can pursue their dreams in a safe, positive, and supportive environment.
Following his tenure as an advisor to President Kennedy, Brezinski served in the Johnson administration.
He served as the National Security Adviser to President Carter from 1977 to 1981, following Henry Kissinger.

He served as an advisor to President Carter in dealing with international issues such as the Iranian Revolution that followed the Iran hostage crisis in 1979, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan in 1979, and the normalization of US-China relations in the late 1970s, including the Camp David Accords in 1978.
This film, starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, was nominated for all major categories.
Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone were each nominated for Best Actor and Best Actress, respectively.
In addition, it has been nominated for Best Work, Best Director, Best Cinematography, Costume Design, Film Editing, Original Screenplay, Production, Sound Editing, Sound Mixing, and Original Script.

The two songs, "Audition (Dream Song)" and "City of Stars", from that movie were nominated for Best Original Song. Lionsgate Studios received a significantly higher number of nominations than other studios, with a total of 26.
US President Donald Trump announced through his spokesperson that American troops will be withdrawing from Syria in a statement released on Sunday evening.
This announcement was made after President Trump had a telephone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
Turkey has announced that it will protect captured ISIS pilots who have been refused repatriation by their home countries in Europe.
This merely confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers and provides additional details such as color and three-dimensional arrangement which are typically lacking in fossils.
Scientists have revealed that the upper part of this dinosaur's feathers was a deep brown color, while the lower part was either white or yellowish.
This discovery also provides insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.

The dinosaur feathers, although lacking well-developed quill knobs, possess other distinctive feather-like features such as filaments and small branch-like structures; researchers have speculated that these other characteristics evolved later to develop into quill knobs.

The structure of the feathers suggests that they were used for temperature regulation or display purposes, rather than flight. Researchers found samples from a young dinosaur's tail and reported them to be adult dinosaur feathers, not downy juvenile plumage.
This is the tail of a young dinosaur, but according to researchers, it can be seen from the sample that it's not the downy fur of an infant, but rather the feathers of an adult.
Yesterday morning, two police officers were killed and more than 20 other people were injured in a car bomb explosion at the police station in Gaziantep, Turkey.
The governor said that among the injured, 19 were police officers.
The police have stated that they are investigating the terrorist group, Daesh (ISIL), who are accused of being responsible for the attack.
They have found that they operate solely on the principle of radiation and rotation, just like other stars.
The brightness and rotation are used together to determine the Rossby number of a star, which is related to plasma flow.
The more Rossby number is, the less active a star's activity will be on its own reversal side.
During his travels, Ishakai encountered numerous obstacles on several occasions.
He was robbed by pirates, attacked by a mad dog in Tibet, almost married in Nepal, and arrested in India.
The 802.11n standard operates on both 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz frequencies.
If there is a dual radio in the base station, it will allow for compatibility with previous models of 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g even if they are older versions.
The 802.11n standard has a theoretical maximum bandwidth of 600 Mbit/s, which is significantly faster than the previous standards.
Dubyah, a married man with two grown children related to this story, did not leave a lasting impression on Miller.
When asked for his opinion, Miller said, "During the hearing, he made many statements... I couldn't hear what he was saying because I had been prepared."
The former Prime Minister said, "He would make a great effort to reduce carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a significant margin compared to the level in 2005 until 2020."
He mentioned that the scale of the reduction would be based on China's economic output, but did not provide a specific number.
They have been encouraged to move away from the old method of polluting first and then cleaning up later.
The Supreme Court added that it should not demand them to bear a duty beyond their developmental stage and scope of responsibility and ability.
Iraq Study Group has released a report today at 12pm GMT (Greenville Standard Time).
At this point, there is no guarantee that Iraq's actions will prevent sectarian wars or violence from increasing, or bring order to the situation.
This report begins with a call for public discussion and consensus-building on US Middle East policy.
The report is highly critical of the current Iraqi policy of the administration from almost all aspects and urges an immediate change in direction.

First, one of the 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic policy should be taken before this year ends to secure borders in preparation for hostile intervention by Iraq and to re-establish diplomatic relations with neighboring countries.

Mrs. Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, the Argentine President's wife and a Senator, announced her candidacy for the presidential election yesterday evening in La Plata, which is 50km away from Buenos Aires.
Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for President at the same place where she started her campaign as a senatorial candidate in 2005, namely the Teatro Argentino in Argentina.
A controversy arose as people who took a conservative approach to government spending on relief supplies and reconstruction after Hurricane Katrina were referred to as "Bush's New Orleans Deal".
Criticism of reconstruction activities from the liberal side has focused on the fact that reconstruction-related contracts have been returned to so-called Washington insiders.
Over 4 million people gathered in Rome to attend the funeral.
Unfortunately, due to the large number of attendees, most people were unable to enter the funeral service held in St. Peter's Square.
Large television screens were installed throughout Rome, allowing people to watch the funeral procession.
In many cities within Italy and other cities around the world, including Poland, similar screens have been installed so that many people can see them.
Historians have criticized the FBI's past policy of focusing resources on easy cases like car theft, in order to artificially inflate their success rate.

The House of Representatives has allocated funds for obscenity prevention measures since the 2005 budget, and the FBI has specifically required that at least 10 agents be assigned to the adult pornography field.
Robin Uthappa recorded the highest score of the inning, hitting a 4-point 11 and a 6-point 2 in just 41 pitches to record the highest score of the inning.
Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid have performed exceptionally well, achieving a century partnership.
However, the claim that India lost only 7 wickets and scored 36 runs to end the innings is not accurate.
President George W. Bush of the United States arrived in Singapore this morning, marking the beginning of a week-long tour of Asia.
He was warmly received by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Sui and had discussions with Singaporean Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on trade and terrorism issues.
Following a week of consecutive defeats in midterm elections, Bush announced his policy for trade expansion in Asia.

The Honourable Steven Harper, the Prime Minister, has agreed to send all party leaders a review of the "Air Quality Protection Act" before he reads it for the second time in the House of Commons following his 25-minute meeting with NDP Leader Jack Layton on Tuesday.

"Mr. Layton requested a thorough and complete rewriting of the Conservative Party's environmental bill during his meeting with the Prime Minister, and urged changes to the Conservative Party's environmental bill."

Since the federal government intervened to take over the funding of the Mercy Hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, state premiers and some federal lower house members have been accusing them of using this action as part of their campaign for the upcoming November federal election.
However, Premier Hodgman said the move was to prevent hospital facilities from being downgraded by the Tasmanian Government and an additional $45 million has been provided.
According to recent reports, the sea level data at the time of the tsunami was recorded and it has been confirmed that a strong tsunami hit Pago Pago and Niue.

There have been no major damage or casualties reported in Tonga, but it is understood that the country's power supply was temporarily cut off and therefore did not receive a tsunami warning from PTWC.
The 14 schools located on the coastal area or surrounding areas of Hawaii were closed yesterday, despite the warning being lifted.
President George W. Bush welcomed this announcement.
Bush's spokesperson Gordon Johndroe stated that North Korea's promise is "a major step towards achieving denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula."
A tenth Atlantic hurricane, Tropical Storm Julia, formed today in the Atlantic.
According to the National Hurricane Center of the United States, Typhoon Rhea is no longer a threat.
It is estimated that the US Army Corps of Engineers can collapse a levee damaged by six inches of rainfall per hour.
The Ninth Ward, which experienced the highest flood of up to 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently overflowing into nearby levees and rising to hurricane height.
Water flows over beyond the levee with a width of 100 feet.
Commons administrator Adam Cuerden expressed dissatisfaction with deletions during a conversation last month with Wiki News.
"He lied to us from the very beginning. He said it was all for legal reasons and acted like he was listening to us until almost the last minute."
Efforts have been made to draft a policy proposal regarding the sexual content on websites that host millions of publicly licensed media due to recent communal resentment.
Although it relies heavily on theory, the program is designed to simulate observations of the Sagittarius galaxy.
The effect that the team was searching for could have occurred due to the gravitational interaction between dark matter in the galaxy and dark matter in the galactic water.
Just like the moon exerts its gravitational force on Earth to create tides, the galaxy also exerts its force on the constellation of Scorpius.
Scientists have concluded that dark matter affects other dark matter in the same way as regular matter.
According to this theory, the majority of dark matter surrounding galaxy clusters is situated around them like a halo and consists of vast numbers of small particles.
News reports show white smoke coming out of the factory.
Local authorities are warning residents near the power plant to stay indoors, turn off air conditioning and refrain from drinking tap water.
According to the Japanese government agency related to nuclear matters, radioactive caesium and iodine were detected at the power plant.
It is believed to indicate that the container storing uranium fuel on site has ruptured and leaked.
Dr Tony Moll has discovered a case of XDR-TB (multi-drug resistant tuberculosis) in the KwaZulu-Natal region of South Africa.
He mentioned that the new variant is "very lethal and very difficult to deal with, and it's scary."
Dr. Moll believed that some patients may have contracted the disease at the hospital and thought that at least two of them were healthy hospital workers.
